title: U.S. stock futures edge higher with Fed rates commentary in the spotlight
text:
* Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average YM00 rose 38 points, or 0.1%, to 33619.

* Futures on the S&P 500 ES00 gained 9 points, or 0.2%, to 3964.

* Futures on the Nasdaq 100 NQ00 increased 33.75 points, or 0.3%, to 11744.

On Thursday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA fell 8 points, or 0.02%, to 33546, the S&P 500 SPX declined 12 points, or 0.31%, to 3947, and the Nasdaq Composite COMP dropped 39 points, or 0.35%, to 11145.

What's driving markets

U.S. stocks faced pressure on Thursday after St. Louis Fed President James Bullard said the fed funds rate may have to climb as high as 7% to restrict economic growth enough to fight inflation.

"Bullard's vocal view that rates need to get to 5-7% was intended to bend the Fed Funds implied curve so cuts priced by investors for the second half of 2023 are priced out. As has been the case throughout 2022, hawkish rhetoric (Jackson Hole, anyone?) creates equity market volatility," said strategists at Evercore ISI.

Bond yields continue to climb on Friday, with the Fed policy-sensitive 2-year Treasury BX:TMUBMUSD02Yyielding 4.48%.

Friday's data calendar includes releases on October existing home sales and leading economic indicators. Boston Fed President Susan Collins is due to give a speech about the labor market, at 8:40 a.m. Eastern.

There's also some $2.1 trillion of options that expire, according to data from Goldman Sachs.

U.S. stock futures edge higher with Fed rates commentary in the spotlight
